QuestionJSON.Question: In biology class, Vesper is studying different ecosystems and mapping them out with their biodiversity. They have two options on how to organize the data: in a 2D grid where each cell represents a different species or in a 3D model where the X-axis represents one ecosystem, the Y-axis represents another ecosystem, and the Z-axis represents different species. What might be a tradeoff Vesper should consider when deciding how to store and organize their data?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: A 2D grid is simple to understand and work with, but it may limit the number of ecosystems Vesper can represent.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: A 3D model can represent more information, but it may be harder to visualize.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: A 3D model is easier to work with because it can store more data.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: A 2D grid is always better because it is simpler.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: Option 1 is correct. A 2D grid representation is easier to understand and work with but could limit the number of ecosystems that Vesper can represent, whereas a 3D model can store more information but may be complicated and harder to visualize and interpret.
